title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 October 2016 - XWiki
content:

11:03 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki

11:03 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <vmassol> welcome back bot! :)  
11:43 <vmassol> good bot!  
11:47 <vmassol> tmortagne/all: do you see any problem to execute macro transformation in a java macro instead of letting the rendering process do that for the macro (i.e the macro returning XDOM on which tx have not been executed)? I'm asking because I'd like to do that for the dashboard macro, see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9583?focusedCommentId=93128&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-93128 ) ?  
11:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: it depends what is inside this macro, when you execute the macro content you don't respect order at the general page level  
11:51 <vmassol> yes indeed  
11:51 <vmassol> in the case the of dahsboard gadgets it could be a good thing actually  
11:51 <vmassol> (to isolate them from the rest of the page)  
11:51 <vmassol> (and from each other)  
11:52 <tmortagne> if something need to be isolated it should be executed as such (not with the rest of the document XDOM around it)  
11:52 <vmassol> ok so I could actually be fixing a bug here :)  
11:53 <vmassol> now I could also break existing usages but that seems unlikely  
11:53 <tmortagne> dashboard gadget don't seems like the kind of use case that need to look at the rest of the document  
11:54 <vmassol> yup  
11:54 <tmortagne> if they do they should probably macros instead of gadgets  
12:05 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <vmassol> , that executes the macro transformation (vs ContentParser which doesn't). Signature will be: XDOM parse(String content, Syntax syntax, MacroTransformationContext macroContext) + the sig with EntityReference. WDYT?  
12:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: then you should call the method execute and not parse  
12:21 <tmortagne> and probably ContentExecutor instead of MacroTransformedContentParser  
12:28 <vmassol> yes good idea  
12:29 <vmassol> although it doesn't indictae that it's the macro that will be executed but that's ok I think  
12:29 <vmassol> \*macro tx  
12:29 <vmassol> actually  
12:29 <vmassol> ContentExecutor and MacroContentExecutor  
12:29 <vmassol> (or MacroTransformationContentExecutor)  
12:31 <vmassol> hmm no  
12:31 <vmassol> yes actually since TxContext is generic :)  
12:32 <vmassol> actually no it's a problem  
12:32 <vmassol> I'll use a generic  
12:34 <vmassol> hmmm another point  
12:34 <vmassol> I wanted to put it in xwiki-platform-rendering-parser with ContentParser...  
12:35 <vmassol> I guess I'll need to create yet another module…
